title: Cape Lookout National Seashore: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations               Permits & Reservations       Permits Some activities within Cape Lookout National Seashore require a special use permit to be issued.  Below are listed the most common activites that require a permit. Long-term vehicle parking: This special permit allows surf fishermen and 4-wheel drive vehicle campers to leave their vehicle in one of the approved lots on the islands during the season.  Learn more about this type of parking permit.  The permit application is available on the special use permit page.  Camping (Groups of 25 or larger): Most family camping does not require a permit.  But if you are bringing a group of 25 people or more you need to apply for a permit.  Learn more about the group camping permit.  Temporary Duck Blinds (during hunting season): Waterfowl hunting is permitted on the seashore.  A lottery is held in September for permits to build a temporary blind on the seashore.  Learn more about the process on the Temporary Duck Blind Information page. Other activites that require the use of a permit are:  Weddings Commercial Filming/Still Photography Scientific Research and Collecting 1st Amendment Activities Cremains (Scattering of Human Ashes)  To learn more about the permits for these and other group activities please see our Special Use Permits page.
